notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: The following Scandinavians bought or sold real estate in Chicago recently:
Arthur C. Carlson to William Hirschfield: Avenue L and 99th Street. Price, $2,800.
Hilmar Hiller to Axel Z. Johnson: Calumet Avenue and 42nd Street. Price, $3,000.
William Detts to Kate Johnson: 89th Street and Cottage Grove Avenue. Price, $6,000.
Emil Hart to Gustave C. Anderson: Norgan and 61st Streets. Price, $3,000.
James T. Parker to Alfred Hallgren: 79th Street and Emerald Avenue. Price, $3,700.
John J. Holpuch to William Johnson: Homan Avenue and 15th Street. Price, $1,000.
H. von Moos to C. W. Christianson: Maplewood Avenue and Hirsch Street. Price, $8,500.
Charles S. Anderson to Anne Hokie: Pine Avenue and Ohio Street. Price, $8,000.
C. C. Carlson to Gustaf Ek: Van Horne's Addition, lot 3, block 2. Price, $4,000.
S. M. Gunderson to James Brown: Gunderson and Sons' Addition, lot 11, block 5. Price, $5,400.
J. Ennis to Burton Hansen: Greenleaf and Southport Avenues. Price, $9,875.
Victor B. Carlsen to William K. Pusback: Lakewood and Morse Avenues. Price, $1,375.
L. J. Emmis to Burton Hanson: Greenleaf and Southport Avenues. Price, $1,500.
Karna Malmstedt to Charles S. Johnson: Price, $2,500.
